snippet: To the Editor:    Your May 9 front-page article ''Many States Slow to Use Children's Insurance Fund'' mentioned that some states couldn't find enough eligible uninsured children to enroll.     Almost 400,000 California children are eligible for th...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your May 9 front-page article ''Many States Slow to Use Children's Insurance Fund'' mentioned that some states couldn't find enough eligible uninsured children to enroll. Almost 400,000 California children are eligible for this new program, yet only 100,000 have signed up. Another 600,000 are eligible for Medicaid but have not enrolled. Overwhelmingly, they are Hispanic children born in the United States, half of whom have at least one parent who is not a citizen.
abstract: Dr Patrick T Dowling letter comments on May 9 article on states that are slow to use health insurance fund for children; notes that in California, almost 400,000 children are eligible for new program, yet only 100,000 have signed up

headline.main: When Elderly Pay Too Much for Drugs
